tidbits.title: Teranga Spirit
tidbits.description: Senegal is known for its 'Teranga' spirit, embodying hospitality and warmth, welcoming visitors with open arms and a rich cultural heritage.

tidbits.title: Goree Island
tidbits.description: Goree Island, a UNESCO World Heritage Site off the coast of Dakar, was a significant hub for the transatlantic slave trade, now serving as a symbol of remembrance and reconciliation.

tidbits.title: Musical Diversity
tidbits.description: The country has a diverse music scene, with genres like Mbalax gaining international recognition, and Senegalese musicians like Youssou N'Dour achieving global acclaim.
